name: Poets and Pronouns
body:
**Poets and Pronouns schedule**

[[schedule of meetings prior to fall 2012]][2]

**Spring 2013. Meetings take place at [<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">10 Washington Place</dfn>][3] (the linguistics building)<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">, 4th floor unless </dfn>otherwise noted.**

**Note on format:** Talks are <dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers dictionary-of-numbers-quantity-3600s dictionary-of-numbers-processed">60 minutes</dfn> in length, followed by a<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers"> 30 minute Q</dfn>&A/comment period. An optional<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers"> 30 minute discussion period </dfn>will follow the initial Q&A/comments, for those who wish to participate. Talks start at **10:<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">44am sharp</dfn>** unless otherwise noted.

  * Friday, February 8.<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers"> 1pm-</dfn>2:<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">30pm</dfn>. Igor Yanovich (MIT). The secret history of 'must' [[abstract]][4]


  * Friday, February 22. 10:<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">44am</dfn>. Linmin Zhang (NYU). A rate analysis of the binominal 'each' [[abstract]][5]


  * Friday, March 8. 10:<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">44am</dfn>. Simon Charlow (NYU). Ellipsis really is binding [[abstract]][6]


  * Friday, March 15. 10:<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">44am</dfn>. Jeremy Kuhn (NYU). ASL loci: Variables or features? [[abstract]][7]


  * Friday, March 29. 10:<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">44am</dfn>. David Erschler (Tübingen). Deriving clause-internal left periphery [[abstract]][8]


  * Friday, April 19. 10:<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">44am</dfn>. Dylan Bumford (NYU).


  * **Tuesday, May 7. 1:<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">45pm</dfn>. Room 104 (in conjunction with Chris Barker's adjectives seminar)**. Timothy Leffel (NYU).


  * Friday, May 17. 10:<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">44am</dfn>. Lucas Champollion (NYU). Quantification and negation in event semantics [[abstract]][9]


  * Friday, May 24. **<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">2pm</dfn>**. **Room 103**. David Beaver (UT Austin).



**Fall 2012. Meetings take place at [<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">10 Washington Place</dfn>][3]<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">, 4th floor unless </dfn>otherwise noted.**

  * Friday, October 5.<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers"> 11am-</dfn>12:<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">30pm</dfn>. Timothy Leffel (collab. with Radek Šimík and Marta Wierzba, U. Potsdam/SFB<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers dictionary-of-numbers-quantity-632A dictionary-of-numbers-processed">632 A</dfn>1). Information structure and pronominal morphology in Basa'a (NELS prep) [[abstract]][10]


  * Friday, October 12.<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers"> 11am-</dfn>12:<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">30pm</dfn>. Hanna de Vries (Utrecht). Sums, higher-order entities, and <dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">two kinds of distributivity </dfn>[[abstract]][11]


  * **Thursday**, October 18.<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers"> 11am-</dfn>12:<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">30pm</dfn>. **<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">10 Washington Place</dfn>, #103.** Hazel Pearson (ZAS Berlin). Logophoric pronouns are not obligatorily de se: evidence from Ewe [[abstract]][12]


  * Friday, October 26.<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers"> 11am-</dfn>12:<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">30pm</dfn>. Dag Westerståhl (Stockholm, collab. with Stanley Peters, Stanford). On the semantics of possessives [[abstract]][13]


  * **Tuesday**, November 27. **2:<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">30pm-</dfn><dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">4pm</dfn>**. Salvador Mascarenhas (NYU). TBA (practice for upcoming talk at MIT)


  * Friday, November 30. **<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">1pm-</dfn>2:<dfn class="dictionary-of-numbers">30pm</dfn>**. Allyson Ettinger (NYU) and Sophia Malamud (Brandeis). Mandarin utterance-final particle _ba_ and conversational goals [[abstract]][14]


  * Friday, December 14. 11am-12:30pm. Ivano Ciardelli (Amsterdam/ILLC). An inquisitive perspective on meaning [[abstract]][15]
